attributes.title: Video Games OFFICIALLY a Health Hazard!?
attributes.description: The World Health Organization has decided video games are a mental health risk. Get in line, WHO! Thing is... there's a lot of disagreement even in the health industry over it.

attributes.title: Battlegrounds Cinematic Universe!
attributes.description: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is the game that nobody can stop playing, apparently -- but it's got even bigger ambitions than that! Prepare for PUBG movies, animes, and probably a musical at some point, because the game's getting its own media empire soon.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch is the Fastest Selling Console EVER
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been doing well, but HOW WELL? Fastest selling console EVER in the US well....

attributes.title: Xbox One EXCLUSIVES LEAK
attributes.description: Xbox had a rough 2017 for exclusives, but they may be looking to turn that around based on a new leak that claims the company is bringing back some of its major original Xbox franchises.

attributes.title: EA Wants to RUIN Matchmaking?
attributes.description: Another huge publisher has filed a patent to mess with matchmaking in order to get you to spend more money! This time, it's EA, and they want to unbalance matchmaking so that you feel more engaged than ever before. That sounds fun, right?

attributes.title: Gamers Are WRONG?!
attributes.description: Insomniac Games says one of the hardest lessons they've had to learn was about... well, not listening to fans the way they used to. The thing is, they're not the only developer that feels that way -- so now we've got a discussion about the balance of fan feedback and creative vision... which one's better?

attributes.title: PlayStation: Don't Worry About Games As Service
attributes.description: PlayStation's new boss has some things to say about his company's vision for gaming... and it doesn't include Games As a Service. In fact, it's very anti Games as a Service, and seems to be focused on singleplayer titles. Plus, they're not the only ones in the industry with thoughts on the matter.

attributes.title: Nintendo Direct OVERHYPED?
attributes.description: Nintendo had a much-hyped Direct after a couple of weeks of rumors. Did it live up to the community's desires and Nintendo's teasing?

attributes.title: BOYCOTTS WORKED? Lootboxes on the Run!
attributes.description: First it was Battlefront 2 pulling pay to win lootboxes from the game. Now Destiny 2 is dropping the paywall and making loot accessible to all players. Looks like players dropping out of games over the practice is working!

attributes.title: TOXIC WORKPLACE Accusations Against Detroit Dev
attributes.description: When you have 180 people working for you, it gets tough to email around photoshops of colleagues photoshopped onto sexy nazis.

attributes.title: Gamers Demand TOO MUCH?
attributes.description: So, basically, it's your fault single player narrative games are going away.

attributes.title: The Triumphant Return of... FABLE 4!?
attributes.description: We thought this franchise had been written off after Fable Legends, but now it's back being worked on by... racing game devs? Cool.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switches to... CARDBOARD!
attributes.description: Why go VR when you can make your video games out of cardboard instead? Seems they've got cats running the show at Nintendo these days.

attributes.title: Streams & Let's Plays KILLING Singleplayer Games?
attributes.description: A big name in game development has spoken out on the decline of single-player games, and believes let's plays and streams are a cause. Why pay and play when you can just watch?

attributes.title: Xbox's Big Plans for NEXT-GEN
attributes.description: Xbox has big plans for next-gen, and we'll start seeing shifts in that direction sooner rather than later.

attributes.title: Is Dragon Ball FighterZ ANY GOOD?
attributes.description: The reviews are in for 2018's first big fighting game, Dragon Ball FighterZ. Forget all the marketing that tells you it will be the BEST THING EVER... What do critics think now they've actually got it?

attributes.title: Never Buy Another XBOX GAME!?
attributes.description: Xbox has announced a huge new project that means Xbox owners never need to buy another first party Xbox game in order to play them.

attributes.title: PS4 JAILBREAK to Play PS2 Games!
attributes.description: Turns out the PS4 can play PS2 games! You just gotta jailbreak it first... as long as you've updated it to the exact right firmware and no further.

attributes.title: Atari EXPLOITING Crowdfunding?
attributes.description: Good news: Atari's bringing Roller Coaster Tycoon to Nintendo Switch. Bad news: the weird crowdfunding campaign seems unnecessary and kind of exploitative.

attributes.title: Destiny 2 Dragging Activision DOWN
attributes.description: Wall Street's not confident about Activision, with Destiny 2 causing downgrades to analyst predictions for the year.

attributes.title: DELAY! BioWare Struggling to FIX Anthem
attributes.description: Now that Mass Effect Andromeda flopped, BioWare NEEDS Anthem to be a success, but the outrage over Destiny 2 and Battlefront 2 have everyone in a panic to fix the game and ensure its success.

attributes.title: You NEED to Play Monster Hunter World?
attributes.description: Reviews are in for Monster Hunter World so you can decide if the game's worth your money! Let's go through the high points and low points of the game.

attributes.title: Retailer Boycotts Xbox!
attributes.description: Xbox Game Pass looks like a pretty sweet deal for gamers. Too sweet for one retailer, who doesn't see why they should even sell Xbox stuff if Microsoft will get to keep all the sweet game money.

attributes.title: 10 Quick Tips for New Monster Hunter World Players!
attributes.description: Jumping into Monster Hunter World? It's dangerous to go alone! Take these tips to get started on the right foot.

attributes.title: Valve Slams Unfair DMCAs by ESL
attributes.description: Esports is a big deal and a lot of people watch it. That means platforms like Facebook are willing to offer a lot of money lock exclusive rights to streams, and DMCAs for anyone who tries to find a way around it. But Valve's not having it.

attributes.title: Facebook is the New Twitch!?
attributes.description: Ready for your grandma to start sharing all her gaming streams on your Facebook feed? Facebook's kicking off their own streaming service to compete with the likes of Twitch and YouTube and... that should be interesting.

attributes.title: Xbox Wants to Buy EA?
attributes.description: A new report suggests Xbox is looking to acquire a games industry giant to bolster its first party development. A giant like... EA, perhaps? or Valve?

attributes.title: More Retailers MAD at Xbox
attributes.description: Last week we had the news that one Austrian retailer was a bit miffed about Xbox Game Pass -- and now we've got word of several more retailers who think it could significantly affect their business.

attributes.title: Why Are Publishers So Greedy?
attributes.description: Lots of people have been talking about not-so-great business tactics in gaming lately -- and unfortunately, lots of companies are set up in a way that makes some of these tactics a priority. We break down the business world of video game companies, and why they operate the way they do.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Has MORE Secrets
attributes.description: Nintendo just released its financial statement and holy crap do people love this machine and all of its Marios (seriously, all the Marios). But with the console hitting crazy numbers and not nearly as good of a release slate as last year, how can it keep up -- well, according to Nintendo, they've still got a lot of tricks up their sleeves.

attributes.title: EA Admits Loot Boxes Hurt Battlefront 2... But Wants Them Back
attributes.description: EA just held its Q3 earnings call, where they finally dished on the fact that Battlefront 2 didn't sell as much as they hoped. And guess what -- it was all because of the loot boxes. But that won't stop them from doubling down on live services.

attributes.title: Nintendo Doing Games As A Service?
attributes.description: Nintendo's made loads of announcements this week about movies, mobile games, and online services -- but one other thing they low-key announced is that they're about to start dabbling in games as a service.

attributes.title: Sony CEO QUITS
attributes.description: Kaz Hirai is stepping down as CEO of Sony -- but what's next for the company? Could it possibly become an acquisition target?

attributes.title: King of Kong is KING OF LIES?!
attributes.description: Infamous gamer and world record holder Billy Mitchell may have just gotten some of his Donkey Kong records stripped... with allegations that he spoofed the footage with MAME instead of playing it live. Does this mean JUSTICE FOR WIEBE?!

attributes.title: Is Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 REAL?
attributes.description: We've got new rumors that this year's Call of Duty is going to be none other than Black Ops 4. Oh, and apparently it might be coming to Nintendo Switch and will be back in the modern era. We break down all the new tidbits -- and how believable they are.

attributes.title: NEW Pokemon Switch Details!
attributes.description: One of the most anticipated Nintendo Switch titles is the upcoming Pokemon RPG -- and now we've got a few more rumors about what we could expect from the game, including P2P details and more information about the art style. Can Nintendo please just show us this game already?

attributes.title: HUGE Red Dead Redemption 2 Leaks!  Battle Royale & First Person!
attributes.description: Even though Red Dead Redemption 2 is coming out later this year, we've known virtually nothing about it. But that might change thanks to some apparent leaks of the game's single player and multiplayer, which tell us a whole lot of cool details... including that Red Dead Redemption is getting its own Battle Royale mode.

attributes.title: Quantic Dream Under Investigation!
attributes.description: Quantic Dream got hit with bad workplace allegations recently, and now the company is fighting back against them with some lawsuits of its own. Unfortunately, the Paris Council is now getting involved to see where the company's government grant money is going.

attributes.title: Google Gets Into Game Consoles!
attributes.description: A lot of companies have tried to take on the console business and failed. Google seems to have its own plans for gaming, and it's... interesting.

attributes.title: Lootboxes OVER? New Laws Proposed!
attributes.description: After a long time of yammering about loot boxes and potential regulation, some Hawaii lawmakers are finally proposing some measures to crack down on them. Is this the end of loot boxes as we know it?! Well, don't get your hopes up.

attributes.title: Spyro the Dragon Remasters Leaked!
attributes.description: Activision's back with yet another huge classic remaster -- this time, it's going to be the Spyro the Dragon series, according to some new reports.

attributes.title: Game Devs on STRIKE!
attributes.description: One studio of French developers have had enough, and now they're officially on strike. Could this be the start of better treatment of video game developers?

attributes.title: Sony Shares PS4 Data with FBI
attributes.description: Tech companies help out law enforcement with all kinds of criminal investigations, but it's not very often that we get to see it happen so publicly. Sony just sent the FBI some PS4 user data for a recent case, and now we're getting more details.

attributes.title: Video Games Blamed for School Attack
attributes.description: After a deadly school attack, politicians are looking for a convenient scapegoat and are settling on their favorite target: video games!

attributes.title: Game Dev Uses DLC to Install Malware
attributes.description: Say you're a developer struggling to find the jerk cracking your game content and posting it on piracy websites. Do you A) try to make a game people desperately want to support, B) distribute your own cracked version that punishes the pirates, or C) deliberately install malware on customer PCs?

attributes.title: Banned Streamer Sues Twitch
attributes.description: Almost 2 years after being banned from Twitch for alleged rigging of CSGO skin gambling and failing to disclose ownership of the site, James "PhantomL0rd" Varga is back and he's suing Twitch. Sounds like it should be pretty clear cut? Not so fast.

attributes.title: System Shock Proves Even the Best Kickstarter Can Fail
attributes.description: RIP System Shock... for now, anyway. The game that taught us how to make a foolproof Kickstarter campaign has...fooled. It's been redesigned and rescoped to death. Or at least hiatus.

attributes.title: Super Smash Bros for Switch in 2018
attributes.description: A Nintendo insider claims Super Smash Bros will be revealed and release for Nintendo Switch this year. We dig into the chances of this happening and what approach Nintendo might take.

attributes.title: Pay MORE for Violent Video Games
attributes.description: Ready to pay more for violent video games that teach you how to kill people? Excellent. Open your wallets.

attributes.title: Saving Your Game? That Will Cost Extra
attributes.description: Ready to take microtransactions to a new level? Konami's there for you! Now you can pay extra if you want more save game slots in metal gear survive! INNOVATIVE

attributes.title: Xbox's Much Needed Reboot
attributes.description: Xbox One didn't have a smooth launch. But not only was there trouble on the outside, there was a lot of internal trouble that required a full reboot of the Microsoft business.

attributes.title: Super Seducer's Super Sexy Censorship
attributes.description: There's a game coming out that teaches you how to trick women into sleeping with you. A reviewer thought it was a bad game. So the developer issued a DMCA strike over it.

attributes.title: Bethesda Put Out Better Games Than Nintendo!?
attributes.description: Time to award best publisher of the year based on average critical reception! You'd have assumed it might go to Nintendo for a strong Switch launch, but you'd be wrong.

attributes.title: ESRB Defeats Loot Boxes? Uh, Well...
attributes.description: The ESRB has seen all the impending legislation against lootboxes and microtransactions and they're taking action! Sort of... in the least helpful way possible.

attributes.title: Regulating Loot Boxes is CENSORSHIP?
attributes.description: The game industry is hitting back at calls for regulation of loot boxes in video games, calling it possible censorship.

attributes.title: No New Nintendo Switch Hardware
attributes.description: People have been calling for new versions of Nintendo Switch since, well, since Nintendo Switch launched KEEP WAITING, DUDES!

attributes.title: BANNED from Violent Video Games
attributes.description: A student has been banned from playing violent video games by a judge after a snapchat about a school shooting. Mario Kart? Apparently totally fine.

attributes.title: Major Shake-up at PlayStation
attributes.description: PlayStation has announced a major internal restructure and new focus for the company.

attributes.title: Battlefield V LEAKS! It Copies Call of Duty!?
attributes.description: Battlefield V or 5 or whatever has sprung a leak! Looks like it's going back to its roots---uh, we mean, copying Call of Duty, clearly--and taking on World War 2. And going for a record in weird naming patterns.

attributes.title: REPORT: Grand Theft Auto VI Location Details!
attributes.description: GTA V came out almost 5 years ago, but still not a whisper of the next game. Lucky for us, an inside source has some details about where it takes place and when it might come out.

attributes.title: Battlegrounds Dev Helping CHEATERS!?
attributes.description: A developer on PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds was accused of helping cheaters and now the studio's involved.

attributes.title: Battlefield V New Details Leak!
attributes.description: Looks like Battlefield V is going to take heavy inspiration from Battlefield 1's storytelling and features.

attributes.title: Rainbow Six Siege Censoring Players!?
attributes.description: Your troll days are numbered. Ubisoft's cracking down on hate speech in Rainbow Six Siege.

attributes.title: Patent Trolls Fighting Microtransactions
attributes.description: Maybe this is the darkest timeline. One of tech's greatest villains, patent trolls, is going after one of gaming's biggest villains: microtransactions.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Beating Xbox One Already?
attributes.description: Surprise! Nintendo Switch has been doing really well since it launched a year ago. So well, in fact, it could already be overtaking Xbox One's lifetime hardware sales.

attributes.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 REVEALED! What You Need to Know
attributes.description: It's official! The new Call of Duty is Black Ops 4. Here's what you need to know about it.

attributes.title: Video Games Get TRUMPED ON
attributes.description: The US government is looking to violent video games and has called the ESA to a panel.

attributes.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake in Trouble?
attributes.description: New job listings indicate the Final Fantasy 7 Remake isn't just a short wait... it's barely in development.

attributes.title: Fortnite Players Getting HACKED
attributes.description: Fortnite players are reporting huge charges they didn't make! Beware of hackers and phishing scams.

attributes.title: Fallout 3 Revival Project SHUT DOWN
attributes.description: A popular mod to rebuild Fallout 3 in Fallout 4 has been shut down over legal concerns after meeting with Bethesda.

attributes.title: Kirby Star Allies ... IS IT GOOD?
attributes.description: Kirby Star Allies drops Friday for Nintendo Switch and the reviews are hitting now. How does it stack up? Let's break it down.

attributes.title: No More Xbox Exclusives?
attributes.description: Xbox is looking at a more platform-agnostic approach to video games. Does that mean they're abandoning their Xbox hardware and giving up? Nope.

attributes.title: 8 Quick Tips Before You Play Sea of Thieves!
attributes.description: Sea of Thieves, the multiplayer pirate combat game, releases Tuesday for Xbox One and PC. Here are some tips to help you kick off your swashbuckling career.

attributes.title: New Bethesda Game SOON?
attributes.description: Bethesda's got a couple of buns in the oven -- and one of them might be ready sooner than you think. Executive producer Todd Howard appeared on a recent podcast and shed just a little bit more light on the company's future plans, with some tiny teases about both new projects. Could one of them be revealed at E3?

attributes.title: Bomb Threats Over Minecraft Shut Down Schools
attributes.description: After an apparent player dispute in Minecraft, a disgruntled player sent bomb threats to more than 400 schools, resulting in evacuations and closures across the UK

attributes.title: Would We Buy/Wait/Skip Ni No Kuni II: Revenant Kingdom?
attributes.description: Ni No Kuni II: Revenant Kingdom is out this Friday! We got some early copies and have played through the game. Let's talk through our experiences with the game to weigh its strengths and weaknesses.

attributes.title: Why Does Everyone HATE Sea of Thieves?
attributes.description: Sea of Thieves is having a rough start--from technical issues, which are common for online games but still troublesome, to concerns that there's just not enough meat to the game

attributes.title: 11 Quick Tips for NI NO KUNI 2 from the Total Pros
attributes.description: We've already put in our fair share of hours on Ni No Kuni 2, and we've got some tips for new players so you don't have to learn everything the hard way

attributes.title: Would We Play/Wait/Skip FAR CRY 5?
attributes.description: We got early copies of Far Cry 5 and played through, so we're talking about what we like and dislike about the game, and weighing how much we'd be willing to pay for it.

attributes.title: Xbox CENSORING Players! Why?
attributes.description: Xbox has announced they'll be cracking down on offensive language by issuing bans from their services. Sounds pretty extreme, but there may be a big legal reason they have to...

attributes.title: Nintendo Switches Bricked! Nintendo Responds
attributes.description: After a new firmware update, Nintendo Switches using third-party docks are getting bricked. After a rash of incidents, Nintendo has responded to the issue.

attributes.title: Jurassic World Evolution Gameplay and Impressions
attributes.description: Eddy visited Frontier Developments to play Jurassic World Evolution and bring back exclusive gameplay and details about the game. Josh and Chris were there too, apparently, but no one knows how they got in.

attributes.title: Sea of Thieves Players REBEL Over First Legend
attributes.description: Sea of Thieves has its first pirate legend! Unfortunately, fans of the game aren't happy with how the player got there.

attributes.title: Court Lays Down The Law on Microtransaction Gambling
attributes.description: A court has weighed in on a case involving microtransactions that could set a precedent for whether they're considered gambling.

attributes.title: PlayStation 5 THIS YEAR? Plus First Hardware Leaks
attributes.description: A new source claims it's got the first hardware details for PlayStation 5, and it might be releasing this year! We dig into it.

attributes.title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy Announced! What Remasters Are Next?
attributes.description: The worst kept industry secret is out, the Spyro Reignited Trilogy is coming!  So we sit down and discuss what game remasters we think are next!

attributes.title: PUBG Suing Copycats!
attributes.description: PUBG's creator hasn't had too many nice things to say about copycats -- and now it looks like the company is suing some mobile games that yanked their idea.

attributes.title: Yakuza 6: Play? Wait? Skip?
attributes.description:
We played through Yakuza 6 to issue our verdicts on what we think of the game and how we'd choose if we had to do it over again.
DISCLOSURE: SEGA provided pre-release copies of the game for us to play.

attributes.title: God of War: Is It Good?
attributes.description: God of War drops next week, but the reviews drop THIS week! So we can finally answer the big question with any game: IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: EA is GOOD Now!?
attributes.description: EA has had a rough year of game cancellations, poor receptions, studio closures, and loot box controversies. But that's all in the past. The company's shuffling its executive team and promising to do better.

attributes.title: Bethesda's STARFIELD Game Coming THIS YEAR?
attributes.description: Bethesda's rumored to be working on a space-themed game called Starfield, and it might be hitting this year! Here's what we know, and what we want.

attributes.title: Nintendo Patents New Hardware!
attributes.description: Nintendo put out the Switch a year ago, but they're not resting. They've already patented some new hardware that could potentially replace the 3DS.

attributes.title: Cyberpunk 2077 is an FPS!? And It's Coming SOON?
attributes.description: A new leak suggests Cyberpunk 2077 could be an FPS game. And rumors suggest it could be coming sooner rather than later!

attributes.title: Xbox SUED By Game Developers
attributes.description: Xbox is facing a lawsuit over patent violations from a video game developer.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Exploit UNFIXABLE
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch has been hacked! Homebrew enthusiasts discovered a hardware exploit that jailbreaks the Nintendo Switch, which raises concerns for piracy and online cheating.

attributes.title: Nintendo Needs to Sell 20 MILLION Switches! Here's How
attributes.description: Nintendo had a great year with the launch of Nintendo Switch, but they need to do EVEN BETTER the next year to meet their goals. We have some ideas how they'll make that happen.

attributes.title: Europe Declares War on Game Industry Giants
attributes.description: A bunch of European countries are all out of patience for video game industry giants and their anti-consumer practices, and they're not going to take it anymore!

attributes.title: Nintendo Labo FLOPS at Launch
attributes.description: Nintendo Labo, the new cardboard initiative from Nintendo, has failed to put up impressive numbers out of the gate.

attributes.title: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds Hackers ARRESTED and Fined MILLIONS
attributes.description: A bunch of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds hackers are facing the music! Following a bunch of arrests, a group of hackers are facing millions of dollars worth of fines for damaging the game.

attributes.title: May's Free PC Games on Twitch Prime!
FTC Tells Console Makers To REMOVE Warranty-Voiding Stickers!
Switch to be BANNED in the US?
The NEXT Legend of Zelda: What You Need to Know!
attributes.description: A job listing for work on a new Legend of Zelda game seems to confirm other hints about what we can expect for the game.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Online KILLED Virtual Console?
attributes.description: Nintendo has detailed their online service features and some of them have fans in an uproar.

attributes.title: NEW DETAILS! What to Expect from Battlefield V and Anthem
attributes.description: EA's spilling a bunch of details about their upcoming games to investors, including when to expect ANTHEM from BioWare and whether Battlefield V will have a campaign.

attributes.title: EA: Loot Boxes are "Here to Stay"
attributes.description: Countries around the world are taking aim at loot boxes and gambling regulations, but EA makes a ton of money off them and they're not going to take it lying down. They say loot boxes are here to stay.

attributes.title: Developer BANNED from Steam
attributes.description: Another game developer has been banned from Steam for trying to game user reviews for a better score.

attributes.title: Sony's Big Change for E3
attributes.description: PlayStation's outlined their big plans for E3 this year, but they're also changing how they approach the event.

attributes.title: CliffyB's Boss Key Studio SHUTS DOWN
attributes.description: Cliff Bleszinski's Boss Key Productions, the studio behind Lawbreakers and Radical Heights, is officially shutting down.

attributes.title: No Man's Sky FINALLY Getting Multiplayer?
Pokémon: Let's Go! for Switch LEAKS! Everything You Need to Know
attributes.description: All the Pokemon Switch rumors are coming together! A new leak has outed Pokemon: Let's Go! with Pikachu and Eevee versions, and a bunch of other details are lining up with previous leaks.

attributes.title: Battle Royale? YES! Campaign? NO! It's Black Ops 4!
attributes.description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 has been officially revealed. As previously speculated, it will NOT have a campaign. Instead, it will have battle royale! After all, that is the new hotness. Oh, and zombies.

attributes.title: Kingdom Hearts 3 ACTUALLY COMING OUT! And... It's Good?
attributes.description: Kingdom Hearts 3 has been a fever dream for fans for a good decade, but the game, announced 5 years ago, looks like it might actually keep its 2018 release date AND it sounds like it's pretty good. So that's a bonus.

attributes.title: State of Decay 2 Review
attributes.description: State of Decay 2 is nearly out! Unless you bought the Ultimate Edition... then you already have it. But if you got the Ultimate Edition you probably weren't waiting to hear about it before you made a decision so you can skip this video. If you DIDN'T get one of those and you ARE waiting to decide... here's what we think.

attributes.title: Fortnite's $100 MILLION Payout
attributes.description: Epic Games is paying out $100 million to players in Fortnite.

attributes.title: Battlefield V REVEALED: Has It Learned from Battlefront 2?
attributes.description: DICE has lifted the veil on Battlefield V, confirming the World War 2 setting, modes, and features.

attributes.title: Detroit: Become Human ... IS IT GOOD?
14 Games TOO SEXY for Steam
attributes.description: Today's a holiday so we're not in the office to make news. Instead, we drank way too much coffee and spent time pouring over all the sexy games that might not be allowed on Steam anymore. For professional reasons.

attributes.title: PUBG SUES Fortnite Over Battle Royale!
attributes.description: PUBG Corp, the company behind PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, is taking Epic Games to court over Fortnite Battle Royale, with accusations of copyright infringement.

attributes.title: Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee TOO CASUAL?!
attributes.description: Pokemon Let's Go has been officially revealed with Pikachu and Eevee versions, but some of its features have gamers concerned this won't be fun for traditional Pokemon fans.

attributes.title: Crackdown 3 Delayed AGAIN?
attributes.description: Crackdown 3 could be facing another delay, based on cancelled pre-orders and rumblings within the industry.

attributes.title: FALLOUT 76 is an ONLINE Game?
attributes.description: Fallout 76 has been announced! Looks like it might be an online game, so we go over the facts and the rumors.

attributes.title: 5 Things We Already Know About ASSASSIN'S CREED: ODYSSEY
attributes.description: Assassin's Creed Odyssey leaked early so Ubisoft went ahead and announced it. Here are 5 major details we now about the game so far.

attributes.title: What's Free for PS Plus, Xbox Live, and Twitch Prime in June
attributes.description: There are 15 games up for grabs for PlayStation Plus, Xbox Live Gold, and Twitch Prime members in June!

attributes.title: 16 Biggest Games to Look Forward To at E3
attributes.description: E3 is coming up quick! Here are 16 of the biggest games we're expecting to learn more about at the show.

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 LOCKS CONTENT for More Money!
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 is one of the most anticipated titles of the year. It's also going to cost you extra if you want all the content, since Rockstar's announced game content exclusive to the special edition.

attributes.title: EXCLUSIVE: EA Indicates SKATE 4 Reveal Soon
attributes.description: Thanks to a tipster, we've got word from an EA support rep to be expecting good news about the future of the Skate game franchise soon!

attributes.title: The E3 2017 Report Card!
E3 2018 Press Conferences Round Up! - EA + Xbox + Bethesda + Square Enix
E3 2018 Press Conferences Round Up! - Ubisoft + Playstation + Nintendo
Telltale Games is BROKE?
attributes.description: Telltale Games has had a few issues lately--layoffs, accusations about toxic workplace, etc. But now the studio's former CEO is suing and the studio is admitting it's not in great financial condition.

attributes.title: CYBERPUNK 2077: 10 New Things We Know
attributes.description: Since we got to see the behind-closed-doors demo of Cyberpunk 2077 at E3, we learned a LOT. Here are 10 of the biggest things we learned, all condensed down nice and tight.

attributes.title: PC Games Have BUILT IN Spyware?
10 Games This Year That Will BLOW OUR MINDS!
attributes.description: During E3 it seemed like every big game was destined for 2019, but that's not the case! There are a lot of big games hitting this year too. Here are 10 of them.

attributes.title: Why Metroid Prime 4 and Animal Crossing Switch Skipped E3
attributes.description: Metroid Prime 4 was announced last year. Animal Crossing has been expected since Nintendo launched Pocket Camp for mobile devices. But E3 came and went with no further word on either project, and Nintendo's explaining why.

attributes.title: Ubisoft Can't Decide Whether The Division 2 is Political or Not
attributes.description: At E3, Ubisoft was admant that The Division 2 wasn't political in spite of the whole destroyed Washington DC thing. Now the company CEO is changing the story.

attributes.title: Blizzard Patenting Overwatch Play of the Game! Is It Anti-competitive?
attributes.description: Blizzard wants to patent Overwatch's "Play of the Game" mechanic. Is that an overly broad patent for the feature? Is it anti-competitive?

attributes.title: CD Projekt RED's Secret Project: Is This The REAL Multiplayer Game?
attributes.description:
CD Project RED is working on something besides Cyberpunk 2077. Is this the multiplayer game all those grants and teases were about?
Visit Bryant and tell him how great he did: https://www.youtube.com/thenerfreport

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch Piracy Tool Has Anti-Piracy DRM
attributes.description: Nintendo Switch shipped with a hardware vulnerability that let homebrew hackers and pirates in. An enterprising piracy tool is here, but gosh darnit. Those pirates want to be compensated for all their hard work. So they put DRM in their tool to protect it from pirates.

attributes.title: Fallout 76: Bethesda Calls Out PlayStation Over Lack of Crossplay
attributes.description: Bethesda Game Studios boss Todd Howards says Sony is unhelpful when it comes to crossplay for Fallout 76.

attributes.title: Most Patriotic Games EVER! Know Buddy Edition
attributes.description: In the mood to play a patriotic game with big guns, big explosions, and bigger eagles to celebrate 4th of July!? Here are the most patriotic games you need to play.

attributes.title: Why Nintendo Confidence is on the Decline
attributes.description: Nintendo's stocks are slipping as investors lose confidence the console can maintain momentum.

attributes.title: Games Can't Afford to Fail Anymore!?
attributes.description: Sony Worldwide Studios boss Shuhei Yoshida thinks the pressure is on for big games to perform well... or take their studios down with them if they fail.

attributes.title: Forget Portal 3! Why We Don't Even Need It (But Think Valve is Crazy Anyway)
attributes.description: Valve still can't count to 3, but maybe we don't need them to, since fans count great and are willing to do the work for them

attributes.title: Pokemon Let's Go! Exclusive Pokemon & How Local Multiplayer Works
attributes.description:
New trailers are out for Pokemon Let's Go, shedding light on some of major features of the games
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BSL7l2Ie_NY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=afhr0E3U1n4

attributes.title: The Culling II is the WORST Game Launch EVER?
attributes.description: A surprise sequel to The Culling dropped this week and... absolutely no one cared. Well, 2 people did. They're playing it. But that's about it.

attributes.title: Bans for In-Game Slurs
attributes.description: Rainbow Six Siege is banning players for the use of slurs in game chat. Is this a good move?

attributes.title: Court Smacks Down Star Citizen Refunds
attributes.description: A court has struck down a suit demanding a refund from the developers of Star Citizen

attributes.title: No Man's Sky is Now YES MAN'S SKY!?
attributes.description: There were a lot of broken promises when No Man's Sky launched, particularly around multiplayer and.... the complete lack of it. 2 years later, that's all changing.

attributes.title: New Xbox Hardware Incoming! We Know What It Is
attributes.description: Xbox has revealed they're announcing new hardware next month! So we got in touch to find out exactly what it is (and isn't).

attributes.title: Why Valve Can't Make Games
attributes.description: Valve's had some real trouble making games lately, but one long-time staffer has insight into why they can't seem to make a game.

attributes.title: Death Threats Over No Man's Sky
attributes.description: After two years of silence, No Man's Sky creator Sean Murray has started talking about the aftermath of the game's launch and the threats the studio received from angry gamers.

attributes.title: Nintendo Sues for More than $100 Million Over ROMs
attributes.description: Nintendo's never had a positive relationship with ROM communities, but now they're taking 2 sites to court for more than $100 million over Nintendo ROM distribution

attributes.title: Xbox Scarlett's Next-Gen STREAMING Console?
attributes.description: Leaks are starting to pop up about the next generation of Xbox hardware, with new claims that Microsoft might offer a console that streams games instead of playing them locally.

attributes.title: Why BioWare Has Changed
attributes.description: A former BioWare legend has opened up about his decades with the studio, why they've lost long-term talent, and the pressures of market success over creativity.

attributes.title: Welcome to FALLOUT: MIAMI! This is Why Mods are Great
attributes.description: Need more Fallout and not ready for the Fallout 76 multiplayer? How about Miami instead? A new fan project takes players to an entirely new and original area, and we'll be really disappointed if Pitbull isn't the final boss.

attributes.title: No Man's Sky Refunds Offered for Players Locked Out of Multiplayer
attributes.description:
No Man's Sky NEXT is a huge update for the game that's revitalized the playerbase and enabled them to play together... well, most of them. Fortunately, for those who can't play together, there are refunds on offer.
Customer Service Link: https://support.gog.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?form=orders

attributes.title: The Loot Box Craze is Over!?
attributes.description: Forza Motorsport 7 is dropping loot boxes. Shadow of War admitted they ruined immersion. DOTA 2 players in the Netherlands are getting transparency about what they're buying. Looks like loot boxes are on the run!

attributes.title: Is Fortnite Really Hurting the Games Industry?
attributes.description: Fortnite Battle Royale is a free-to-play phenonenon... but when it comes to the rest of the industry, is that success eating their lunch?

attributes.title: Scam Game on Steam Installs Cryptomining Malware! Valve Responds
attributes.description: A game on Steam was caught dropping scam items in-game and stealthily running cryptomining software on players' computers! Valve's responded, but how did full-on malware get on the platform in the first place?

attributes.title: Fable is Saved? Star Devs Recruited to New Project
attributes.description: Playground Games, the studio behind the worst-kept-secret rumored Fable project are recruiting star talent to help them with their new project.

attributes.title: Let's Get to Know... CHASM
attributes.description: Chasm is out today! We kinda want to check it out, so... let's do that!

attributes.title: 17 FREE GAMES for PS Plus, Xbox Live, and Twitch Prime in August! For Honor, Mafia III, and more...
attributes.description: Every month Xbox Live, PS Plus, and Twitch Prime offer you free games to keep you subscribing. If you pay for any of those, here are the free games you can claim this month!

attributes.title: Is the New Spider-Man Game Worth the Hype?
attributes.description: The new Spider-man game is coming out in a month! Before that, it's time to unleash the early hands-in impressions to get an idea how good the game will actually be!

attributes.title: Everyone Already Hates Call of Duty: Black Ops 4?
attributes.description: We're through Call of Duty: Black Ops 4's first beta weekend and so far fans are NOT impressed with the multiplayer changes... which is a problem because this game only has multiplayer!

attributes.title: IGN Plagiarized a Review from a YouTuber
attributes.description:
IGN's in hot water with gamers after a YouTuber discovered the IGN review of Dead Cells was eerily similar to their own review, leading IGN to remove the review and investigate the editor responsible.
Boomstick Gaming's Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pMuGpIt1XL4

attributes.title: Let's Get To Know... Dead Cells
attributes.description: Dead Cells is the new procedurally-generated roguelite metroidvania game in town, and it will make you love it even when you hate it. We sit down, go over the game features and mechanics, and show you the early gameplay you can expect to face.

attributes.title: Multiple New Diablo Projects Confirmed
attributes.description: Blizzard is hopping back on the Diablo train! Multiple new projects have been confirmed by the studio, so now the big question is... which ones?

attributes.title: Nintendo Kills Off Luigi! RIP Player 2
attributes.description: Nintendo has killed off Luigi in a new video, which makes it pretty much canon now. Jerks. Let's remember the ultimate player 2.

attributes.title: ROM Sites DOOMED?
attributes.description: With Nintendo suing some high-profile ROM sites, is this the end for ROMs on the internet?

attributes.title: Doom Eternal Gameplay Reveal!
attributes.description: We get our first look at gameplay for the upcoming Doom Eternal!

attributes.title: Fallout 76 Perks and PVP Details!
How Ninja's Controversial Policy Affects Streamers
Bethesda PRESSURING Sony For Crossplay!
Pokemon Let's Go Games Already Underperforming?
Battlefield V in Trouble?
attributes.description: Battlefield V numbers aren't where EA has been hoping to see them, and one of EA's top execs is leaving the company.

attributes.title: Diablo 3 Switch CONFIRMED!? Everything We Know (so far)
attributes.description: We've been eagerly awaiting confirmation of Diablo 3 on Nintendo Switch, and it's here! Courtesy of a prematurely-published Forbes article, we've got details on price, exclusive content, and more for the game.

attributes.title: New Cyberpunk 2077 Visuals and What They Teach Us
attributes.description: CD Projekt RED released new screenshots for Cyberpunk 2077 at Gamescom. Here's what they teach us and what they confirm of the earlier E3 demos.

attributes.title: Let's Get to Know... GUACAMELEE 2
attributes.description: Guacamelee 2 is out! Let's talk features and... oh who are we kidding? We really wanted an excuse to play this at the office.

attributes.title: EA Prepared for Battlefield V to Fail
attributes.description: EA's got a Fortnite-style plan to save Battlefield V if its launch is a bust.

attributes.title: Miyamoto's Warning to Greedy Developers
attributes.description: Nintendo legend Shigeru Miyamoto isn't a fan of greedy developers, and he's got a warning for the companies nickle and diming their consumers.

attributes.title: Xbox as a Subscription, Console Included
attributes.description: Xbox may be rolling out a subscription service that includes the physical Xbox, showing they may be learning to... think outside the box.

attributes.title: 48 Minutes of Cyberpunk 2077 Gameplay with Commentary, Analysis, & PC Specs
attributes.description: Join us as we break down the 48 minute Cyberpunk 2077 gameplay demo CD Projekt RED dropped today, run through the demo PC specs, and get some extra details from Adam's demo at e3.

attributes.title: Nintendo Switch NEEDS Indies to Succeed?
attributes.description: Nintendo's relying heavily on indie games this year, to fill holes in its own first party lineup. Does this trend indicate the company's leaning on indies for success over AAA games? And what's that going to do to the online store?

attributes.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Demo Details You May Have Missed
attributes.description: CD Projekt RED finally revealed gameplay for their long-anticipated futuristic RPG, Cyberpunk 2077. We caught some details in the gameplay you might have missed if you got distracted by any of the other brilliant details.

attributes.title: The Division 2's Confusing Versions and Paid Advantages
attributes.description: The Division 2 doesn't just have a standard and collector's edition--it has 6 DIFFERENT VERSIONS, and players are concerned that some of them offer unbalancing advantages in-game.

attributes.title: Spider-Man Downgrade Accusations!? Welcome to Puddlegate
attributes.description: Spider-Man hits PS4 next week, and some fans are concerned that new shots from the game don't look nearly as impressive as they did at E3.

attributes.title: 18 Free Games in September for PS Plus, Xbox Live & Twitch Prime! Destiny 2, God of War 3, and More
attributes.description: Every month PlayStation Plus, Xbox Live Gold, and Twitch Prime offer a bunch of bonus games to keep you subscribed. Here are the freebies you can score in September!

attributes.title: Spider-Man: Should You Play It Now, Wait, or Skip It?
attributes.description: Spider-Man is out this week for PlayStation 4. We scored early copies from Sony and took the game for a spin. Here's what we think of it.

attributes.title: PlayStation's Response to Console Crossplay
attributes.description: Crossplay has been a hot topic with gamers and console makers in recent months. Now, the highest authority at PlayStation's responded to explain just why Sony's not interested in it.

attributes.title: 2K: Microtransactions are Here to Stay
attributes.description: A developer at 2K says microtransactions are inevitable and they're not going anywhere.

attributes.title: Let's Get to Know... SPIDER-MAN! The First Hour of Gameplay
attributes.description: It's Spidey time! Check out the full first hour of gameplay to see how the story, combat, city traversal, collectibles, and more work.

attributes.title: Nintendo's Cloud Saves Show It Still Doesn't 'Get' Online
attributes.description: Nintendo's upcoming Online service rolls out this month, but more little details are showing that the big N still has some catching up to do with its online services... like how some games won't support cloud saves because that might... make... cheating... easier?

attributes.title: Shadow of the Tomb Raider: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.description: Shadow of the Tomb Raider is this week's entry into the Holiday 2018 motherlode of games, and the reviews are in to answer.... IS IT GOOD?

attributes.title: EA Under Criminal Investigation Over Loot Boxes!?
attributes.description: EA loves its loot boxes... so much so that the company may end up in court defending them in Belgium after the company refused to remove them from its games.

attributes.title: NBA 2K19 Punishes Players With Microtransactions!
attributes.description: 2K promised that after NBA 2K18's greedy tactics that they would not make the same mistakes with 2K19...well at least the haircuts are free.

attributes.title: YouTube: Copyright Gone Wild
attributes.description: Man, YouTube kind of sucks these days for creators. The copyright system is bonkers on top of everything else that's happening around algorithms and monetization.  Good thing we have our own website!

attributes.title: Streamers Skipping Twitchcon for Safety Reasons?
Animal Crossing Switch Announcement + More Nintendo Direct News!
Is Fortnite Causing Divorces!?
Lootboxes VS The World - UK Gambling Commission Taking Action!
Everything You Need To Know: Nintendo Switch Online
First Details for Red Dead Online!
Will the Playstation Mini Be Worth It?
Big Changes to PlayStation Now! Is It Worth It Now?
attributes.description: PlayStation Now's undergoing a huge revision that will enable downloading games in its library, not just streaming them. This may make the service more relevant and indicates the company is still learning new tricks from Xbox.

attributes.title: Telltale Games Shuts Down
attributes.description:
Telltale Games announced mass layoffs of its staff today, keeping on only a skeleton crew to finish out the studio's remaining obligations, effectively shutting down the studio.
UPDATE: This story is still developing, and now the case may be that the remaining staff is finishing Minecraft: Story Mode, not The Walking Dead, as we speculated in this update, and TWD may be canceled immediately after all. We'll provide a further update in Monday's roundup.

attributes.title: Do Devil May Cry 5's "Pay to Progress" Microtransactions Cross The Line?
attributes.description: Devil May Cry 5 will feature microtransactions that will let you purchase in-game currency to spend on abilities to power up your character without the work. Is this across the line, or is it irrelevant because the game is single-player?

attributes.title: Telltale Games WRONG to Complete Walking Dead Instead of Paying Employees?
attributes.description: Following fan outcry over Telltale Games shutting down before completing the final season of The Walking Dead, the studio says they may look for funding to finish it. There's just one problem... many think they should pay their employees severance first.

attributes.title: PlayStation Backs Down and Enables Cross Play... Sort Of
attributes.description: PlayStation has backed down from its "this man is totally an island and that's ok" stance to enable cross play... kind of. For one game. For now... BUT IT'S A START!

attributes.title: Ubisoft DEFEATS Vivendi!
13 Free Games in October for PS Plus, Xbox Live & Twitch Prime! Darksiders, SOMA, and More
Will Google's Project Stream Revolutionize Gaming?
Warner Bros. Confirms Harry Potter Game With DMCA + More Details!
12 Months of Major Game Industry Layoffs
New Switch Coming 2019!
Are ROMs Legal?
We Played Fallout 76! Here's What We Know...
attributes.description: We went to West Virginia to get a first hand look at Fallout 76...here's what we learned!

attributes.title: The Biggest Games Still Coming in 2018!
Welcome to the Wasteland! Fallout 76 Extended Gameplay Walkthrough
attributes.description: Eric and Brian give you an hour long tour of the multiplayer wasteland that is Fallout 76.

attributes.title: PSN ID Changes ON THE WAY... Here's The Catch!
7 Mostly Obvious Tips to Survive in Blackout
attributes.description: Brian and Ben give you some tips to survive Call of Duty's new battle royale mode, Blackout.

attributes.title: Strange Messages BRICKING PS4 Consoles!
attributes.description: Over the weekend some odd messages began appearing in some PSN users inboxes causing their consoles to be unusable!  Here are some tips to avoid this issue until Sony patches the problem!

attributes.title: Rockstar Working 100-Hour Weeks for Red Dead Redemption 2!?
attributes.description: Brian and Gus sit down to discuss Rockstar leadership's recent statement about 100-hour work weeks.

attributes.title: What Exactly IS "Games As A Service"?
attributes.description: With companies like Ninja Theory, Capcom, SquareEnix, EA, Ubisoft, and more starting to solidify their future projects firmly in the "Games as a Service" category, it's time we finally sit down and figure out exactly what that means.

attributes.title: What Went Wrong At Telltale Games?
attributes.description: Crunch, massive re-writes, broken promises... Emily Grace Buck, former narrative designer for Telltale Games, spoke at the Sweden Game Conference and gave some insight into what exactly went wrong at Telltale Games and what the industry could do to prevent the same mistake from happening again.

attributes.title: Treyarch DOWNGRADED Black Ops 4 Servers!
attributes.description: Players of the newest in the Call of Duty game poured onto Reddit over the weekend claiming that Treyarch had downgraded Black Ops 4's servers to 1/3rd of the performance they had during the game's beta period...and they were right!

attributes.title: How Soon Is Too Soon for a Price Cut?
attributes.description: Brian and Ben look at the recent backlash from Shadow of the Tomb Raider being discounted after only being out for a month and ask the question, when is it okay to for a game to go on sale?

attributes.title: Is Bethesda Trying To Temper Fallout 76 Expectations?
attributes.description: Ahead of its Fallout 76 beta, Bethesda Game Studios released a letter discussing its feelings on the upcoming online multiplayer survival game. Ben and Brian take a look at the letter and ask, what was Bethesda's goal with the letter, and should we be worried about Fallout 76?

attributes.title: Battlefield V Releasing Incomplete?
attributes.description: EA just released Battlefield V's content road map, and the big news is the battle royale mode, Firestorm, is not going to be available until March. Is Battlefield V being released before it's ready?

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2: IS IT GOOD?
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 is out tomorrow but the reviews are already pouring in, so with all the critics weighing in...is it good?

attributes.title: Video Game Preservation WINS!
attributes.description: The Library of Congress has officially created fair use exemptions to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act that will allow for archivists to save classic video games from going extinct!

attributes.title: Not Enough Classic Games on the PlayStation Classic?
attributes.description: The full 20 game lineup for Sony's PlayStation Classic was announced today, and Brian and Ben share their thoughts on what Sony got right, where they missed, and the possible reasons why.

attributes.title: Nintendo Says MORE DLC Coming For Existing "Big" Games!
attributes.description: At their most recent earnings meeting Nintendo President Shuntaro Furukawa mentioned that he wants more DLC for existing major titles.  Could that mean we get more content in Breath of the Wild, Mario Odyssey, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Splatoon 2, and others?

attributes.title: Nintendo Say the 3DS Isn't Dead!
attributes.description: In Nintendo's recent meeting with investors they've continued their messaging that the 3DS will continue to live on!

attributes.title: Red Dead Redemption 2's Big Time Bug
attributes.description: Missing some folks in your Red Dead Redemption 2 camp? You're probably not alone.

attributes.title: The Roster Has Arrived! - Nintendo's Final Smash Ultimate Direct
attributes.description: Nintendo has dropped a tremendous amount of info and content on us in the final Super Smash Bros Ultimate direct, is it everything we could have ever wanted? ... Ben and Kdin say no, because Isaac got trophied.

attributes.title: 14 Free Games in November for PS Plus, Xbox Live & Twitch Prime! Yakuza Kiwami, Battlefield 1, and more!
attributes.description: The monthly offerings of free games from the various subscription services has arrived!

attributes.title: BlizzCon 2018's Big Announcements Disappointing?
attributes.description: We take a deeper look into the BlizzCon's Day 1 announcements that some fans are calling a bit underwhelming.

attributes.title: Has Blizzard Permanently Alienated Fans?
attributes.description: Blizzcon's Diablo Immortal announcement still has fans a bit irritated; has Blizzard finally lost their goodwill from gamers?

attributes.title: Activision Stocks DROP Due To Diablo Immortal
attributes.description: The fallout from the Diablo Immortal announcement has traveled all the way into Activision-Blizzard's pocketbook!

attributes.title: Square Enix's Major Meltdown!
attributes.description: Square Enix did a Final Fantasy XV celebration stream yesterday and what did they announce to celebrate the series?  All future DLC past Episode Ardyn has been cancelled, Nomura hasn't truly started work on the Final Fantasy 7 remake, Hajime Tabata has left both Luminous Productions and Square Enix, oh, and a $33 million dollars loss for the company!

attributes.title: Activision In MORE Trouble!
attributes.description: BlizzCon's Diablo Immortal announcement dropped Activision's stock by 6.74%, but after a recent investor call their stock took yet another big hit.

attributes.title: What Happened at Xbox's XO18
attributes.description: Microsoft hosted it's XO18 event this past weekend, and we're here to give you a quick round up of what happened.

attributes.title: Pokemon Let's Go: Is It Good?
attributes.description: The reviews for Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu and Let's Go Eevee are here, but are these games good? Brian and Ben take a look and discuss these non-mainline Pokemon experiences.

attributes.title: Fallout 76's Rough Start
attributes.description: Fallout 76 is live, but there are bugs, issues, and unrest among the fans. Ben and Brian dig in to find out what's going on.

attributes.title: Why is PlayStation Skipping E3?
attributes.description: Following Sony's announcement that they will be opting out of E3 2019, Brian and Jenn discuss what the company's reasoning may be.

attributes.title: Fans HATE Fallout 76?
attributes.description: With sales down more than 80% and concurrent players down 50% from Fallout 4, fans of the series are making their voice heard: they do not like Fallout 76!

attributes.title: Best Black Friday Deals for Gamers!
attributes.description:
You want deals! We found deals!

We also have links:
https://www.walmart.com/cp/black-friday/1076614
https://weeklyad.target.com/promotions?code=Target-20181117&lnk=PreviewtheBlack&page=1
https://www.bestbuy.com/site/black-friday/sale-ad/?category=doorbusters
https://blackfriday.com/ads/black-friday/amazon

attributes.title: Our Favorite Family Games To Play Over The Holidays
attributes.description: It's that time of year and family gatherings abound, so we're here to take a quick glance at some games that are great for some after feast socializing!

attributes.title: Bethesda Being Sued?
attributes.description: Amidst the fan backlash from Fallout 76 a law firm has opened up an investigation into Bethesda's somewhat shady refund practices; will this turn into a full on lawsuit?

attributes.title: FTC Announces Lootbox Investigation
attributes.description: The FTC has stated in a Senate committee hearing that they will investigate loot boxes. Is this the beginning of the end for loot boxes?

attributes.title: Red Dead Online Economy BROKEN?
attributes.description: The Red Dead Online beta launched earlier this week and players are already making complaints that the economy is a disaster!

attributes.title: 14 Free Games in December for PS Plus, Xbox Live & Twitch Prime! SOMA, Dragon Age II, and More
Will Rockstar Fix Red Dead Online's Economy?
attributes.description: Rockstar has issued a statement about the current state of the Read Dead Online economy and what they plan to do to fix it, but will it be enough?

attributes.title: Our Predictions for The Game Awards
attributes.description: The Game Awards are tonight! Who will win? Brian, Ben, and Jenn sit down and try to predict the winners and losers of this year's awards.

attributes.title: Borderlands 3 EXCLUSIVE Details!
attributes.description: We've learned some huge NEW information about Borderlands 3 from a credible source, so let's dive into the world of Pandora to see what the next installment may have to offer!

attributes.title: The Game Awards 2018 Reactions!
attributes.description: We recap the winners and losers of The Game Awards 2018, did your favorite take home an award or did it get the shaft?

attributes.title: Is Epic Games Store Hoarding Exclusives?
attributes.description: With the recent announcement that Super Meat Boy Forever's PC version will be a timed exclusive for the Epic Games Store, gamers are wondering if Epic is being a bit too greedy.

attributes.title: Did the Switch have a Sophomore Slump?
attributes.description: We take an in-depth look at how the Switch fared in its second year on the market...did it succeed or did it have a sophomore slump?

attributes.title: 2018's Weirdest Gaming Moments
attributes.description: From Soulja Boy getting into the gaming business and parents hiring Fortnite tutors to Spider-Man's Puddlegate and The Year of Bowsette... 2018 was a wild ride for game news!

attributes.title: Should Red Dead Redemption 2 Be Game of the Year?
attributes.description: Red Dead Redemption 2 is really great, but does it deserve game of the year honors? Brian, Ben, and Gus discuss.

attributes.title: Our Top Games of 2018
attributes.description: Brian, Ben, and Cricket sit down and discuss their top 5 games of 2018.

attributes.title: Why Are There So Many Broken Games?
attributes.description: With Fallout 76 releasing with a ton of problems this year, we take a look at the factors for what leads to these broken launches and what could possibly be done differently.

attributes.title: Xbox One 2018 - Year of Backwards Compatibility and Features
attributes.description: While Xbox continues to lag behind in sales and exclusives, they had a good year in terms of interesting features and providing access to older games. But what does that mean for the future?

attributes.title: PS4 2018 - Year of Exclusives
attributes.description: PlayStation continued to dominate the console market this year with a strategy focused on exclusive games, but what does that mean for the future?

attributes.title: Games We're Looking Forward to in 2019
attributes.description: 2019 is here! Here are the games we're most looking forward to this year.

attributes.title: Nintendo QUITTING Consoles?
attributes.description: The Know discusses current Nintendo president Shuntaro Furukawa's statements that they could be shifting away from home consoles and focusing more on mobile.
